txt.en: 'By the law of Théoden King, I demand that you arrest all of them! Kill them if you must!'
Uthrad
Adalbert
'We will defend Stanric, [placeholder]! Fight well!'
'What are you waiting for, you cowards? Do the king's bidding at once!'
'Yes, sir....'
'Please stop! I yield!'
'You! What are you waiting for, hm?'
'Of course you shall share of our bread, traveller. It is tradition. Sithric, do you not agree?'
'You are a fool, Stanric. Your failure to make reasonable decisions is what made my place here necessary.'
'Stanric will listen to what you have to say. Sithric, on the other hand... well, we shall see.'
'Things were not always this bad here. We have few men, it is true, but it used to be that we could get things done.'
'Stanric, will you hear our appeal, sir? Stangard is beset with many hardships.'
'This Uruk filth must be locked away, so as to prevent him from causing further harm! Are we in agreement, Sithric?'
'Of course, Gadda. You have my ear, [placeholder].'
'Do you think me an utter fool? This is nothing more than the Uruk-hai's cunning ploy.'
'Stangard's situation has grown dire. Our guest has seen many of our hardships firsthand.'
'This mongrel would love nothing more than for us to consider Saruman, one of our greatest allies, as a traitor. '
'The men are so hungry that they cannot perform their duties. They are overworked.'
'Oh, how they would laugh as we turned friend to foe! They hope for us to attack each other, only to be beaten by their unseen armies.'
'Our lands, once so carefully patrolled, have been allowed to grow perilous!'
'An ill-conceived ruse. This is precisely why you need me, Stanric, to see through trickery such as this!'
'Gadda, take this creature from my sight. Send him back to whichever dark hole he crawled from.'
'Uruk, listen to me now. Take this message back to your tribe....'
'Stangard is strong, and it is wise. We will not succumb to sword, nor scheme. Your efforts are for naught.'
'For the last time, [placeholder], you will not meddle in events that are of no concern to you! I am more than capable of seeing to the affairs of Stangard.'
'For Stanric's sake, I will do as you command, Sithric, but I could not disagree more with this decision.'
'I am sorry, sir, but this is wrong.'
'Treason! Do you think you will find mercy at Edoras, when you are tried by Gríma for your defiance?'
'Forgive me, [placeholder]....'
'No more! I cannot win. My heart is not in this fight.'
'You will all pay!'
'Gadda, your words are noted. Please go back to your post now.'
'Gadda! You will do as I say. Back to your watch-post, now.'
Stangard
Mead Hall
'May we meet again in better circumstances, [placeholder].'
'Of course you shall share of our bread, traveller. It is tradition. Sithric, do you not agree?'
'The exposure of this White Hand Uruk-hai is most shocking indeed.'
'I shudder to think that Saruman may now be our enemy and is enlisting Orcs from the Misty Mountains to his cause.'
'Our troubles already seemed numerous, and now it seems that even our allies have become our enemies!'
'It is true. Our hunting parties oft do not return, and our food-stores dwindle alarmingly.'
'Life was always a struggle here, but never so dire as now!'
'As now? Say what you really mean, Gadda! Do not mince your words for my benefit.'
'Go on, Gadda. Tell us all what is on your mind!'
'I will say it, since you will hear it. Things have grown far worse since your arrival, Sithric.'
'The king appointed you, but you only thwart all of our efforts to improve things here!'
'Gadda, please -- do not say these things. As you said, Sithric is here by the decree of Théoden King....'
'Correct. I am here because Stangard failed the king. You all answer to me.'
'I am here to see that things are run properly. If you resist my decisions...'
'...then you resist the will of the king. And you will do well to remember that, Gadda.'
'You shall never get away with what you did, Sithric.'
'We now have witnesses to your lies!'
